channel.title: Watchdog Transparency Blog - Most recent 5 featured articles

item.title: ETF Growth Continues in 2020
item.author: John Cheffers
item.description: The sheer number of new ETFs created annually indicates that many of them many represent highly risky investment strategies.

item.title: Are We Making the Same Mistakes with ETFs that We Made with CDOs?
item.author: John Cheffers
item.description: Most ETFs arenâ€™t technically derivatives, but they may pose similar risks.

item.title: Online Brokers are ... Not Brokers?
item.author: John Cheffers
item.description: Currently, online brokers are operating in a gray space. They seem to want to replace traditional brokers, as evidenced by their marketing and the services they offer. Yet they do not want to take on the responsibility of making suitable recommendations for investors.

item.title: Who is Auditing SPACs?
item.author: John Cheffers
item.description: The number of SPACs exploded in 2020, exceeding the number of traditional IPOs for the first time ever. That growth looks like it will continue in 2021. SPACs have been around for a long time, however, they have only recently generated significant interest and capital.

item.title: SPACs in the Cayman Islands
item.author: John Cheffers
item.description: Our research indicates that only 3.3% of all companies are incorporated in the Cayman Islands, and that includes some companies that are actually located there. In contrast, 28% of all SPACs are incorporated in the Cayman Islands, despite the fact that 88% of them are located in the United States.
